sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: An American soldier is arrested in North Korea after crossing the border with the South without authorization.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: An agreement between the EU and Tunisia gets a cold reception in the European Parliament as MEPs grill the bloc's Home Affairs Commissioner, Ylva Johansson.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Wildfires in Greece destroy forests and cause the evacuation of thousands of residents and holidaymakers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: An American soldier has been arrested in North Korea after crossing the country's heavily fortified border with South Korea.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The man is said to have been on a tour to the Korean border village of Panmunjom and crossed into the north without authorization.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: He's believed to be held in North Korean custody and the UN command is working with North Korean officials to resolve the incident.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: It comes amid increased tension between North Korea and the United States, who deployed a nuclear-armed submarine to South Korea on Tuesday for the first time in four decades.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Allies have warned North Korea that any use of nuclear weapons in combat would result in the end of its regime.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: However, periodic visits by U.S. nuclear submarines to South Korea were among several agreements reached by the two countries in April in response to North Korea's expanding nuclear threat.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: An agreement on managing migration recently signed between the E.U. and Tunisia is getting a cold reception in the European Parliament after a grilling by MEPs of the bloc's Home Affairs Commissioner, Ylva Johansson, on Tuesday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: They're questioning a political agreement with the Tunisian government which is accused of not respecting human rights, dismantling its own democracy and attacking migrants.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: It's very clear that the president of Tunisia is not respecting fundamental rights and we don't think that the European Commission can, let's say, actually enforce that.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: We see a situation in Libya where actually the Libyan Coast Guard is accused of being part of a smuggling network.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: So we are paying the smugglers in Libya.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: And I think we have to learn out of these situations and not just do the same thoughts again.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Many MEPs also criticise the fact that the deal was sealed by a political trio labelled Team Europe, composed of European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen, Dutch Prime Minister Mark Rutte and Italy's Giorgia Meloni.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: But who are they? It's like a resigning Prime Minister, right-wing nationalist Meloni, and the president herself.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: That's not how we should be doing these kind of important policy decisions and political decisions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Commissioner Johansson has defended the political agreement, though, arguing that cooperation with non-EU countries is crucial to migration management.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: I do not agree with the description that Tunisia is blackmailing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: I think that we have a good cooperation with Tunisia, but it's also important to strengthen this cooperation and to step up the support to Tunisia, and this is the aim of this memorandum of understanding and especially the migration part of it.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Very few right-wing MEPs in the Parliament showed up and none defended the agreement during the debate.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: In which waters does the new British immigration law navigate?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Not in those of international legality, according to the United Nations. Coinciding coinciding with their rival endorse it on Tuesday of a giant boat intended to accommodate 500 asylum seekers the UN Commissioner for Human Rights says a new law passed by MPs on Monday is contrary to the UK's obligations under international human rights and refugee law and warns that it will have profound consequences for people in need of international protection.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: It also includes measures to transfer irregular arrivals to what they say are safe third countries.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Under the legislation anyone reaching the country illegally by boat will be refused the right to apply for asylum in the UK.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Both the boat and the bill are part of Prime Minister Rishi Sunak's strategy to prevent migrants from reaching Britain in small boats across the English Channel. In 2022, more than 45,000 people made the crossing and several lost their lives in the attempt.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: 我會跟他談我會跟他談

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: 我會跟他談我會跟他談我會跟他談我會跟他談我會跟他談我會跟他談我會跟他談我會跟他談我會跟他談我會跟他談我會跟他談我會跟他談 China and the United States are the two most powerful economies in the world.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: We also have to be the two largest emitters of greenhouse gases.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: And so the imperative of our two countries coming together and working and showing the rest of the world how we can cooperate and begin to address this with the urgency it requires is incredible.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Rescue is searching for the missing in South Korea.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Over 40 people have died and about 10 others are still missing after more than a week of torrential rain caused severe flooding and landslides. At least 14 deaths were reported in this underpass in the center of the country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Some 15 vehicles, including a bus, were in the tunnel when a nearby river burst its banks.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: More than 10,000 soldiers have been dispatched to support rescue works.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The rainfall has forced thousands of people to evacuate and left many households without power.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Wildfires outside the Greek capital Athens continued to burn through forest land early

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: on Tuesday morning. Evacuation orders have been issued for at least six seaside communities as two major fires edged closer to summer resort towns and gusts of wind hit 70 kilometers an hour.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Water dumping aircraft were deployed early on Tuesday to help dozens of ground crews and mobile units battle three wildfires in the regions of Attica, Corinth and Viotia for a second day.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The biggest blaze appeared to be in Dervinoria, about 45 kilometres north-west of Athens, but fires in the East Attica seaside resort of Serenida and outside Loutraki in Corinth were also active despite ongoing efforts to contain them.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Three volunteer firefighters in Serenida were hospitalized after sustaining eye injuries and officials say homes have been destroyed in both Serenida and Loutraki. Greater Athens and much of southern Greece were on the second highest level of alert for wildfires on Monday and Tuesday following a four-day heat wave which had eased over the weekend. Temperatures are expected to soar again later in the week.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Ukraine's armed forces say there were several overnight attacks by drones.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Explosions were heard in Mykolaiv and the Black Sea port of Odessa.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: They said dozens of attack drones of Iranian origin were used in the raids, adding that Odessa was also targeted with Kalibr cruise missiles but that all the rockets were shot down.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, Russia said its armed forces also shot down 28 Ukrainian drones over Crimea on Monday night.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Writing on Telegram, the Defense Ministry said 17 were destroyed by air defenses, while a further 11 were what it called neutralized and crashed after failing to reach their targets. Russian President Vladimir Putin, meanwhile, has promised a response to Ukraine's second attack on a key bridge in Crimea, which took place early on Monday morning.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: The Kremlin said traffic is now flowing again on the crossing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Putin said he expected concrete proposals to improve security on the bridge, which is important for supplying Russian troops in Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: More mercenaries from Russia's Wagner military group are set to have rolled into Belarus as part of the deal that ended their mutiny. Film of some Wagner members instructing Belarusian territorial defense forces was released last week, although the video hasn't been independently verified.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: There are reports of over 100 vehicles carrying Russian flags and Wagner insignia heading towards a field camp that Belarusian authorities have offered the company.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: President Alexander Lukashenko, who brokered a deal that ended last month's rebellion launched by Wagner chief Evgeny Prigozhin has said that his country's military could benefit from the mercenaries' combat experience.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: In Russia, Wagner's main base is closing down, according to a report on a Telegram channel linked to the paramilitary group.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: A post showed a video of flags being lowered at the base, which is located in Russia's Krasnodar region.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The base in Molkino is ceasing to exist, was the message, and the group is leaving for new deployment sites, it went on to say.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Prigozhin ordered his mercenaries back to their camps after striking a deal to end the rebellion in exchange for an amnesty for him and his men and permission to move to Belarus.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Tourism is booming in Croatia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: More than 9 million people have visited the country so far this year and over 41 million overnight stays have been recorded, a 12% increase compared to 2022.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The government says this is thanks to its accession to both the Eurozone and the Schengen area on the 1st of January this year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: But it may have made life a bit tougher for locals, at least initially.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: As part of the Eurozone, we make it easier for the tourists that are coming from the Eurozone.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: They don't have to look for exchange offices, they don't need to check the rates.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: But I think for the people who live here, it was a big change and people are still trying to adapt also to the new prices.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Many Croats are finding inflation hard to handle.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: It peaked at 13.5% last November, and while it has gradually been coming down, there was a spike in January when Croatia switched to the euro.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: But not everyone is concerned.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The prices are going up already for several years, so this is nothing special. Inflation has now fallen to 7.5% and some tourists are seeing the benefits. Tourism accounts for 20% of Croatia a kroatusok ekonomiájához, tehát ez a country-hoz is fontos.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: A momentben, de a turizm a kroatoknak és a figyelmeknek és a figyelmeknek egy nagy különbségével.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Az általunk megkérdezett horvátok azt mondták, hogy az euró bevezetése óta hatalmas lett a drágulás, viszont sokkal kevesebb a turista.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Etől függetlenül az emberek optimisták, amire meg is van az okuk, hiszen az elmúlt hónapokban egyre több európai fapados légitársaság indított járatot ide az Adria déli részére.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Az Euronews Siposegyi Zoltán tudósította Trogirból.
